message.content:
We start by extracting the relevant values from each statement:

1. Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio  
 • From the cash flow statement, the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = 116257.19  
 • From the income statement, Net Profit = 963263.19  
 • Ratio = Operating Cash Flow / Net Profit = 116257.19 / 963263.19 ≈ 0.1208  
  Rounded to two decimals, this is approximately 0.12  

2. Current Assets Turnover Ratio  
 • We use Total Revenue (3025437.82) from the income statement.  
 • The balance sheet shows “Total Current Assets” at the beginning of the period is 8000000.00 and at the end is 10022038.12.  
 • Average Current Assets = (8000000.00 + 10022038.12) / 2 ≈ 9011019.06  
 • Ratio = Total Revenue / Average Current Assets = 3025437.82 / 9011019.06 ≈ 0.3359  
  Rounded to two decimals, this is approximately 0.34  

3. Quick Ratio  
 • Quick assets normally include items that can be converted quickly into cash. In this problem we sum: Cash on Hand, Bank Deposits, Interest Receivable, and Accounts Receivable.  
  Cash on Hand = 3537257.19  
  Bank Deposits = 4579000.00  
  Interest Receivable = 14869.76  
  Accounts Receivable = 1716911.17  
  Total Quick Assets = 3537257.19 + 4579000.00 + 14869.76 + 1716911.17 = 9848038.12  
 • Total Current Liabilities (from the balance sheet) = 967271.87  
 • Quick Ratio = Quick Assets / Current Liabilities = 9848038.12 / 967271.87 ≈ 10.17  

Now, presenting the result in the requested JSON format:

{
  "solution": {
    "Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "0.12",
    "Current Assets Turnover Ratio": "0.34",
    "Quick Ratio": "10.17"
  }
}
